name: setuptools-scm
description: the blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags

repo.name: setuptools-scm
repo.description: the blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with clear purpose and good configuration examples, though lacking troubleshooting guidance and practical use case examples.
readme.top_issue: Missing troubleshooting section for common issues like version detection failures, Git tag format problems, or build errors

injection_risks.description: The use of `os.path.abspath` and `Path` objects may lead to potential path traversal issues if not properly sanitized.
The use of `subprocess` module with user-controlled input can lead to command injection vulnerabilities.

security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential path traversal and command injection issues, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices for input validation and error handling.

common_complaints: Warnings triggered incorrectly with custom build backends
File system write permissions issues in read-only installations
Configuration detection breaking when setup sections are removed
Version detection failures on git tags
praise_themes: Users express satisfaction with core functionality
Tool integration with modern Python packaging standards
sentiment.summary: setuptools-scm shows moderate community health with active issues spanning configuration edge cases, build system compatibility, and file system constraints, but no signs of project abandonment.

red_flags: hostile tone in response to alternative tool suggestions
lack of patience with repeated or basic questions
communication.summary: The responses are generally technical and helpful, but could be more patient and welcoming.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-12)
46 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months indicates unresponsive maintenance
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no development activity
Recent commit followed by complete inactivity suggests potential project abandonment
positive_signals: Last commit is very recent (2026-01-12), suggesting project wasn't abandoned long ago
maintenance.summary: setuptools-scm appears abandoned with a recent commit followed by zero maintenance activity, unresponsive issues, and no active contributors over the past 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and clear, with breaking changes marked but lacks explicit migration guides.

project_metrics.description: the blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides clear and detailed information on the package's functionality, installation, and configuration, but lacks comprehensive troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Insufficient documentation of common problems and solutions for troubleshooting
Communication: hostile tone in response to alternative tool suggestions
Communication: lack of patience with repeated or basic questions
